topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Deploying Django applications

body.p: Your app needs a top-level wsgi.py file with a global variable named application that refers to your Django WSGI application. The file should already exist in the Django project, although a copy of it needs to be in the root directory in order for Application Lifecycle Service to recognize it.
body.codeblock: django-admin.py startproject dj14 cd dj14 cp dj14/wsgi.py wsgi.py
body.p: Typically, the wsgi.py file is just three lines of code:
body.codeblock: import os import django.core.handlers.wsgi application = django.core.handlers.wsgi.WSGIHandler()

section.p: There are various ways to serve static files for a Django application. While Option #1 is the most recommended for production deployments, option #3 is the simplest for non-production/development/test/QA deployments.
